column2: Fundamental unit of ecology. Has a membrane, transforms and moves energy, and alters the condition of the environment.
Capable if interbreeding or share genetic similarity
Results of breeding two different species and the offspring can create viable offspring (Donkey and zebra, lion and tiger)
understand how adaptations allow an organism to survive in its environment
individuals  of the same species living in a particular area
Examines variation in the number, density, and composition of individuals
distribution is the extent of th and or water within which a population lives
total number of individuals
number per unit area
number of age, gender, or genetics
Populations of species living together in a particular area.
understanding the diversity and interactions of organisms living together in the same place
One of more communities of living organisms interacting with their nonliving physical and chemical environment
Describes the storage and transfer of energy and matter
All ecosystems on earth combined by wind, water, and movement of organisms.
Examines movement of energy and chemicals over the earth's surface.

Matter and energy cannot be created or destroyed, can change form. Ecological systems can gain or lose energy. Organization of community is important. What organisms do with their energy makes them different.
an attribute of an organism (morphology or behavior)
the set of genes a organism carries, determines an organisms phenotype.
changes of genes in a population through differential survival and reproductions of individuals with certain phenotypes
individuals very in traits, traits are heritable, variation in traits causes some individuals to experience higher fitness.
